translation.en: Nice ride.
It does the job.
What job, delivering pizzas?
translation.ja: どんな？ ピザの配達？

translation.en: Well, it's not the ride, it's the rider.
What the hell was that?
What?
Hey! You talking to my girl?
-Oh, shit. Here we go. -Yeah.
She was just admiring my ride.
translation.ja: 俺の車をほめてくれた

translation.en: My ride.
My grandma's Buick could smoke that piece of shit, trailer trash.
translation.ja: バアさんのビュイックでも 勝てるぜ

translation.en: Well, what about your daddy's Viper?
This beast's got 500 horsepower and a Borla exhaust system.
translation.ja: こいつは500馬力 “ボーラ”のマフラー

translation.en: It does 0 to 60 in, like, 4.3 seconds.
-Yeah. -Wow. You can read the brochure.
Why don't you nice boys let your cars do the talking?
I only race for pink slips.
This car goes for 80 grand. What would I do with a broken-ass piece of shit like that?
translation.ja: 俺のは８万ドルだ そんなボロ車 どうする？

translation.en: How about me?
Winner gets me.
translation.ja: 勝ったほうに― あげる

translation.en: Woo! Go, go, go!
First one out the other side.
Make it interesting, Clay.
Shit!
I thought you loved me.
Oh, well.
What the hell?
Guess I got a new date for prom.
♪ Said the boogie said up jump the boogie ♪
-Clay, stop the car! -Shut up!
Stop it!
Clay, please stop! Please stop!
translation.ja: クレイ　お願い やめて

translation.en: Can I get a copy of that?
translation.ja: それコピーしてくれる？

translation.en: You think this is a joke, huh?
You see Ken and Barbie over there?
They're gonna walk out of here without even a slap on the wrist.
translation.ja: あいつらは無罪放免だ

translation.en: Mommy and Daddy are too hooked up.
But I like screw-ups like you. You know why?
translation.ja: 俺はお前が好きだ 分かるか？

translation.en: 'Cause you're 100 percent guaranteed conviction.
translation.ja: お前は 絶対に有罪になる

translation.en: -Where's my car? -I crushed it.
translation.ja: 俺の車は？ 始末した

translation.en: You did what?
-Sit down! -Easy. Easy.
You're done. You understand me?
You're done. And all before your 18th birthday. Now sit down.
Sean.
What the hell were you thinkin', huh?
Mrs. Boswell? Please.
It's--it's Miss.
Officer, is it illegal to smoke in here?
translation.ja: 刑事さん　ここで タバコ吸っていい？

translation.en: It's a tough state. And it's a pretty clear-cut case.
translation.ja: この州は厳しい 罪状は明らかです

translation.en: He'll be lucky if they don't try him as an adult.
translation.ja: 未成年では済みません

translation.en: This is our third town in two years.
translation.ja: ２年で三度も 引っ越したわ

translation.en: Your son's got two priors for reckless driving, willful destruction of property.
translation.ja: 息子さんは 二度も無謀運転と 器物破損で捕まってる

translation.en: This makes it strike three.
They're definitely gonna want to get him off the streets.
Well, there's just got to be another way.
So, where are we moving this time?
We are not moving anywhere.
Sean.
I thought you were gonna be here on the 7th.
Today is the 7th.
Well, look, just hold on one second.
Come on in.
This is it.
You know, Sean, I was-- I was gonna be there.
translation.ja: 迎えに行くつもりだった

translation.en: But your mom, she said the 7th, see,
and we're a day ahead of you in Japan.
Well, you're here now, and that's good.
translation.ja: まあ無事に着いてよかった

translation.en: So, how is your mom?
Where do I sleep?
Now, Sean, you know she had no other choice. I mean, it was either this or juvie hall,
translation.ja: 今回は仕方なかった 少年院かここかだ

translation.en: I mean, you just can't keep moving away every time you get into trouble.
translation.ja: 引っ越しを続けてられない

translation.en: Worked for you.
Look, neither of us asked for this.
translation.ja: お互い望んだわけじゃない

translation.en: But I promised your mom I'd take care of you.
translation.ja: だがママに世話すると 約束した

translation.en: So you just go by the rules her and I agreed to,
translation.ja: ママと私でルールを決めた

translation.en: and I'm sure you'll manage just fine.
Rules?
Yeah, rules. Real simple.
translation.ja: ああ ルール　簡単だ

translation.en: You go to school, you come back here right after.
translation.ja: 学校へ行き 終わったらすぐ帰宅

translation.en: And I don't want to see or hear about you anywhere near a car.
translation.ja: 車に近づくことは 絶対禁止だ

translation.en: Here, the bedroom is yours.
translation.ja: ここが お前の部屋だ

translation.en: Make yourself comfortable.
Lights out in ten.
You got to be kiddin'.
-Wrong train. -Huh?
I'm new here.
-Boswell-kun? -Boswell, yes, ma'am.
Japanese food is like the Army.
Don't ask, don't tell.
Name's Twinkie. Hey, I noticed you ain't have a laptop.
translation.ja: トゥインクだ パソコンないだろ？

translation.en: I'll hook you up. Half price.
translation.ja: 売ってやる　半額だ

translation.en: No, I'm cool.
60 percent off. Hmm? Since we're both army brats and everything.
translation.ja: ６割引き 軍人のガキ同士だろ？

translation.en: I ain't got no cash, man. And I ain't an army brat.
translation.ja: 軍人のガキじゃない 金もない

translation.en: All right, all right. Well, what about a cell phone, huh?
translation.ja: 分かったよ　携帯電話は？

translation.en: Everybody needs a cell phone.
No offense, but I'm probably not gonna be here long enough to remember your name.
translation.ja: 悪いが こんな所に 長くはいない

translation.en: Then you gonna need some new shoes to book town with, man.
You like Michael Jordan? I love Michael Jordan.
translation.ja: マイケル･ジョーダン 最高だぞ

translation.en: Check this out.
Brand new Jordans. Not even out yet.
LeBron James couldn't even get his hands on those.
translation.ja: “レブロン･ジェイムス”でも 手に入らない

translation.en: You selling that Sparco steering wheel?
Hell, no. That's mine right there. Man, I even paid retail for it.
translation.ja: こいつは俺んだ 定価で買った

translation.en: What you drive?
Oh, my ride?
-Yeah. -Yeah. My ride's one of a kind.
Show me.
Thought you weren't stickin' around.
All right.
Slamming, huh? Look at that car.
translation.ja: スゲエだろ？ この車 見ろよ

translation.en: At least let me drive.
Y'all better have some real cars around here.
Okay. I see somebody got jokes, huh?
translation.ja: 冗談コクんじゃねえぞ

translation.en: Well, all right. I don't know if you're ready for them, though. You look a little nervous.
translation.ja: よし 行ってビックリすんなよ

translation.en: What up, Tosh?
For when you blow your wad, man.
Hear that?
It's still not right for the way I drive.
I don't need a computer to tell me about my throttle response.
translation.ja: コンピュータで何が分かる？

translation.en: Okay. Then we're done here.
You wouldn't have that problem with a V8.
Boys.
All they care about is who's got the biggest engine.
translation.ja: 大きけりゃいいと思ってる

translation.en: I'm a guy. It's in my DNA.
So y'all race with these things, huh? Cute little toys.
translation.ja: こんなのでレースを？ オモチャだ

translation.en: You know, I almost didn't recognize you without your slippers on.
translation.ja: あのスリッパの男の子ね

translation.en: Don't you mean wabaki?
Neela, right?
You're a quick learner.
So, where you from, anyway?
Here.
No. I mean, not where you live. Where'd you come from?
translation.ja: 住まいじゃない　出身だ

translation.en: Does it really matter where I'm from?
Who's the tourist?
What's with you and the schoolgirls, D?
translation.ja: 何で女子高生なんかと？

translation.en: You're moving up in the world.
translation.ja: もっとマシな女と 付き合え

translation.en: You gotta elevate your company.
translation.ja: もっとマシな女と 付き合え 水曜にヤッて木曜も

translation.en: Wednesday, Wednesday, meet Thursday.
Ladies, hold that thought, all right?
translation.ja: 待っててくれ　またね

translation.en: He was just leaving.
I'm sorry. I don't speak Japanese.
Understand that? Gaijin?
translation.ja: こういうことだ　ガイジン

translation.en: We were just talking.
This isn't your scene.
That word you called me, gaijin or something or other,
translation.ja: 今の言葉 “ガイジン”とか何とか

translation.en: what does that mean exactly?
Means, turn around, keep walking.
translation.ja: 意味は “背中を向けて―” “消えうせろ”

translation.en: That's exactly what we gonna do.
Come on, man, let's roll.
Yo, look, man, he's Yakuza.
Now, see, that's funny,
translation.ja: そうか どうりで… ここは 自由の国だと思ってた

translation.en: 'cause I thought this was, like, a free country
translation.ja: どうりで… ここは 自由の国だと思ってた

translation.en: Where a girl could talk to whoever she wants.
translation.ja: 女性は誰とでも話せる

translation.en: You know who I am, boy?
Yeah. You're like the Justin Timberlake of Japan, right?
translation.ja: 日本の“ジャスティン･ ティンバーレイク”

translation.en: Leave.
Damn, man. You know Yakuza? The Mafia?
translation.ja: よせよ　ヤクザだぞ マフィアだ

translation.en: Look, sorry, DK-san. Monkey didn't have his banana today.
translation.ja: ごめん　ＤＫさん このサル バカで

translation.en: Hey, D, let's go. It's time to race.
translation.ja: ＤＫ 行こう　レースだ

translation.en: Hey, good luck, Timberlake.
translation.ja: 頑張れ　“ティンバーレイク”

translation.en: You're the one that's lucky, 'cause I'm about to race.
translation.ja: 運がよかったな 俺はレースがある

translation.en: Then let's race.
With what, huh? Your skateboard?
translation.ja: 何で？ スケボーでか？

translation.en: Easy to sound cocky when you got no ride.
Take mine.
Let's race.
What? I wanna see what the kid's got.
Can he drive?
Can he drive?
You know what DK stands for?
Donkey Kong?
Drift King.
Drift?
What do you mean, drift?
Still need a dictionary?
You know that real famous painting? The one of the woman who's smiling all the time?
translation.ja: “永遠の微笑み”の絵を 知ってるか？

translation.en: The Mona Lisa.
Right, right, right, right. Mona Lisa.
Well, look, man, this car right here's like the Mona Lisa of the drift world.
translation.ja: この車は ドリフト界の モナリザだ

translation.en: Han rebuilt this bad boy from ground up.
translation.ja: ハンが完ペキに改造した

translation.en: We talking forged pistons,
translation.ja: 鍛造(たんぞう)ピストン

translation.en: bigger turbo, new rods, new crankshaft.
translation.ja: 大型ターボ　新品のロッド

translation.en: Hey, man, Han's labor ain't cheap, man, you feel me?
translation.ja: ハンの仕事は安くないぜ

translation.en: Well, if I needed a 30-second lesson on how to drift--
There's lots of ways you can do this, all right?
Hand braking is the easiest, so the first thing I want you to do, I want you to rip that e-brake.
translation.ja: 簡単なのはハンドブレーキを 使う方法だ

translation.en: All right?
translation.ja: 簡単なのはハンドブレーキを 使う方法だ ブレーキを引いて すぐフカす

translation.en: After you rip the e-brake, then I want you to power over.
translation.ja: ブレーキを引いて すぐフカす

translation.en: You know what? Just don't mess up Mona, all right?
translation.ja: ともかくモナリザを壊すな

translation.en: All right.
Ready.
Set.
Go!
I told you.
Damn it!
Damn it!
Don't leave town.
Do you know what time it is?
I thought it was around 7 o'clock.
You know, U.S. is a few hours behind.
translation.ja: アメリカは時差がある

translation.en: Looks like the party was better here, anyway.
translation.ja: パーティを 楽しんでたんだろ？

translation.en: Have you been racing, Sean?
You're out of here.
Go ahead.
You don't get it, do you? You have nowhere else to go.
translation.ja: 偉そうに ほかに行く所があるか？

translation.en: If it doesn't work out here, you're going to jail. Do you get that?
translation.ja: ここがダメなら少年院だ 分かってるのか？

translation.en: This isn't a game. And I'm gonna tell you one more time,
translation.ja: これは遊びじゃない もう一度言うぞ

translation.en: if you're gonna live under my roof, you're gonna go by my rules or get out.
translation.ja: この家にいたければ 私のルールに従うのだ

translation.en: Understand?
Understand?
Yes, sir.
Get in.
I'll get you your money.
Why you talking like you have a choice?
There's a guy in there with a paw that owes me some money.
translation.ja: “ツメの刺青(いれずみ)”男に 金を貸してる

translation.en: A paw?
Go get me my money.
Han said, um...
okane.
Han said okane.
Let's go.
You're in the pickup and delivery business now.
translation.ja: これから回収屋をしろ

translation.en: I might call you once a week or once an hour.
I don't care if you're sick as a dog or in bed with Beyoncé. I call, you show.
translation.ja: 例え“ビヨンセ”と寝てても 電話したら来い

translation.en: Only if you teach me how to drift.
This ain't a negotiation.
I wasn't negotiating.
What's he doing here?
He's paying me back for that crumpled beer can sitting in my garage.
translation.ja: こいつがツブしたビール缶の 弁償をさせてる

translation.en: Hope he's not driving.
Gaijin.
When is your next race? I'd really like to be there.
translation.ja: 次のレースは？ 見に行ってやる

translation.en: Why not be in it?
You heard me.
Ready to lose another car, Han?
I'm ready to take that '86 Corolla off your hands.
All right. Put up the '72 Skyline.
translation.ja: いいだろ　そっちは 72年のスカイラインだ

translation.en: Done.
What do you think, Morimoto, huh?
Get him out of here.
We have business to discuss.
Your shipment's late.
Since when are you so worried about the details?
When is the shipment arriving, Han?
Just sit pretty and let me handle it.
Hey, Dad, it's me.
I had to stay after school for some extracurricular activities.
translation.ja: 放課後 課外活動がある

translation.en: So I'll be home a little later.
Sir.
You really need to stop following me around.
What are you doing here?
I thought I'd stop by and ask your boyfriend for some drifting lessons.
translation.ja: 君のカレに ドリフトを習おうと

translation.en: Trust me. You don't wanna be a part of this world.
translation.ja: 彼らに近づかない方がいいわ

translation.en: It's good enough for you.
You don't know anything about me.
translation.ja: あなたには分からない

translation.en: Well, why don't you think I know?
'Cause I'm a gaijin? An outsider?
translation.ja: よそ者の ガイジンだから？

translation.en: Let me guess. You're an army brat who moved around a lot.
translation.ja: きっと 君は軍人の娘で 引っ越しばかり

translation.en: Your mama and daddy was never home.
So you walked around pissed off all the time
and now you found your family with these drift nuts.
translation.ja: そしたら ドリフト仲間と会った

translation.en: Zero for one, cowboy.
Why can't you go find a nice Japanese girl like the rest of the white guys around here?
translation.ja: ガイジン男なら 日本人女を口説け

translation.en: Is everything okay back there?
I can handle DK.
I thought he's Yakuza.
His uncle's Yakuza.
He's just playing gangster in his little storage room.
translation.ja: あいつは ただのチンピラだ

translation.en: But I need him.
He keeps Uncle Kamata from poking around too much.
translation.ja: お陰で 叔父貴が甘くなる

translation.en: What do you mean?
Well, his uncle gets a piece of the action from everyone on his turf.
translation.ja: 叔父貴は シマから アガリを撥(は)ねてる

translation.en: We're on his turf.
50 percent of something is better than 100 percent of nothing.
translation.ja: ５割払えば あとは好きにできる

translation.en: So have you raced DK?
Why not? Is he that good?
translation.ja: なぜしない？ 勝てないから？

translation.en: What's the point of a race?
To see if I'm better than the other guy.
Just proves you're faster, that's all.
If I were to race, it would have to be for something important.
translation.ja: もっと意味があればやるが―

translation.en: Or why else do it at all?
Why are you letting me race?
'Cause you're DK's kryptonite.
And you owe me a car.
Oh, shit.
What the--
Police cars here are only factory-tuned.
translation.ja: パトカーは既製のチューンだ

translation.en: You can do better than 180k, they can't catch you, so they don't even try.
translation.ja: 180ｋｍ以上は追いつけない 追いもしない

translation.en: You know what? I'm beginning to like this country already.
translation.ja: この国が好きになってきた

translation.en: Danny!
Oh, you're looking good.
Disco.
We gotta catch up. Get you a drink on me, huh?
Let's go.
Uh-oh. Easy now, ladies.
Come on.
What's up?
Keep your hands off the kid, girls.
He's underage.
Ladies, ladies, ladies.
Disneyland for grownups, huh?
All these girls, man, they look like--
What, models? Check it out.
translation.ja: モデル いいか　東京は東洋の ファッションの中心だ

translation.en: See, Tokyo is the fashion capital on this side of the planet, all right?
translation.ja: いいか　東京は東洋の ファッションの中心だ

translation.en: Now, imagine you been posing all day. I mean, that's a lot of hard work.
translation.ja: モデルだって大変な仕事だ

translation.en: Not only do you get tired, but, on top of that, you wanna have a little fun, but you can't 'cause you don't even know nobody in town.
translation.ja: すこしは楽しみたい でも周りは知らない奴ばかり

translation.en: And most of the guys around here are too chicken shit to even try picking up one. So what do you do?
translation.ja: 日本の男は声もかけない 根性なし

translation.en: Man, you talk to the little dude who makes you laugh.
translation.ja: 女は楽しい男が好きだ

translation.en: Look, man, I don't just think outside the box. I tear it up.
translation.ja: 俺はクチだけじゃない ちゃんとやる

translation.en: That's my thing.
Sean!
-The red Evo's yours. -♪ There it go ♪
What do you mean?
You're representing me now. What you think, I'm gonna let you roll in a Hyundai?
translation.ja: 俺の代わりだ “ヒュンダイ”に乗れるか？

translation.en: My mother, she's blind in one eye and she can drift better than that.
translation.ja: 目の悪いお袋だって あれよりマシだ

translation.en: Han, where did you find this guy?
Will someone please teach this guy how to drift?
translation.ja: ドリフトを教えてやれ

translation.en: Is that yours?
Sure is.
What happened?
I don't know. I found it this way at the base.
translation.ja: 知らん　基地に転がってた

translation.en: It's got potential.
Yeah, maybe. We'll see.
translation.ja: まあな　どうなるか

translation.en: You know, Sean, the Japanese have a saying.
translation.ja: 日本に ことわざがある

translation.en: The nail that sticks out gets hammered.
You're gonna be late.
Sean!
Come on, man, you broke it.
There must be a misunderstanding.
Out of my way, or you're next.
translation.ja: ジャマすんな どけ！

translation.en: Take it easy.
Hey, look, man, I don't do refunds, all right?
Okay, let's go, then!
Let's go!
Here.
Try not to break this one.
Say, man! What the hell is wrong with you, huh?
Now everybody's gonna want exchanges around here.
translation.ja: これで みんな返品に来る

translation.en: Damn!
Not easy saving the day, is it?
Maybe you could give me some pointers sometime.
You're doing all right.
Thanks.
Yeah?
Sorry about the other night.
translation.ja: こないだは ごめん

translation.en: Your life isn't any of my business.
It's okay.
Foul!
That was a foul.
-Yo, you in my face. -That was a foul.
Hey, Han, sort this wanker out.
-A wanker? -What do I look like, a zebra?
translation.ja: 俺を？ 俺は審判じゃない

translation.en: So, how did you end up over here, anyway?
Well, you know those old Westerns
where the cowboys make a run for the border?
translation.ja: 西部劇を知ってるか？ カウボーイが国境に逃げる

translation.en: This is my Mexico.
Why'd you let me race with your car?
You knew I was gonna wreck it.
Why not?
'Cause it's a lot of money.
I have money.
It's trust and character I need around me.
translation.ja: 信頼できる奴がほしい

translation.en: You know, who you choose to be around you lets you know who you are.
translation.ja: 人は付き合えば 正体が分かる

translation.en: And one car in exchange for knowing what a man's made of,
translation.ja: そいつを知るためなら―

translation.en: that's a price I can live with.
Look at all those people down there.
They follow the rules, for what?
They're letting fear lead them.
What happens if they don't?
Life's simple. You make choices and you don't look back.
translation.ja: 人生は単純だ “選んだ道は後悔するな”

translation.en: So, if you don't drift to win, what do you drift for?
translation.ja: 勝負しないなら なぜドリフトする？

translation.en: You really want to know?
Okay. Let's go.
There's no "wax on, wax off" with drifting.
translation.ja: ドリフトに教科書はない

translation.en: Learn by doin' it.
The first drifters invented drifting out here in the mountains by feeling it.
translation.ja: 最初の男は この山で覚えた

translation.en: So feel it.
Again!
What's in this bag?
You'll see.
translation.ja: 見てろ これだ　いくらある？

translation.en: How much you got? Keep going, keep going.
translation.ja: これだ　いくらある？

translation.en: I'm so good, man, I could sell rubbers to a monk.
translation.ja: 坊さんにコンドームでも 売れる

translation.en: Again.
Again.
Oi, oi, oi, oi.
Watch it. Watch it. Not too early, now.
translation.ja: ガマンしろ　あわてるな

translation.en: Go, go, go, go!
translation.ja: 行け　行け　行け！

translation.en: Don't lose it! Don't lose it!
Hey, Twink.
Get this man a bunk.
Pleasure doing business.
It's actually not bad. I didn't even have to put ketchup on it.
translation.ja: うまいよ ケチャップもかけてない

translation.en: See, I'm not a total gaijin.
I hate that word. It's what they used to call me when I was a kid.
translation.ja: イヤな言葉　子供の頃 よくそう呼ばれた

translation.en: I thought you were born here.
Well, "outsider" can mean many different things.
translation.ja: “ガイジン”は いろんな意味があるわ

translation.en: My mom died when I was 10.
translation.ja: 私が10歳の時 母は死んだ

translation.en: She came out here from Australia when she finished high school.
translation.ja: 母は高校を出て オーストラリアから来たの

translation.en: And all I know about her is that she went to work in a hostess bar.
translation.ja: ずっとホステスの 仕事をしてた

translation.en: DK's grandmother took me in.
Well, my parents split up when I was three.
translation.ja: 両親は３歳の時に別れた

translation.en: Me and Mom moved around a lot. Mostly 'cause of me.
translation.ja: お袋と引っ越しばかりしてた けっこう俺のせい

translation.en: Well, it was all 'cause of me.
translation.ja: そう 全部 俺のせいだ

translation.en: Kind of made myself an outsider,
translation.ja: 自分を“よそ者”にしてた

translation.en: you know, without even thinking about it.
But I realize now, outsider or insider, it doesn't really matter.
translation.ja: だが“よそ者”も“仲間”も 関係ない

translation.en: All that matters is knowing what you really want and going after it.
translation.ja: 大事なのは やりたいことを― やることだ

translation.en: We used to come up here when we were kids.
translation.ja: 子供の頃 よく来たわ

translation.en: Even before we could drive we'd cut class, sneak out,
translation.ja: 運転できなくても 授業をサボって―

translation.en: come up here, and watch the older kids drift.
translation.ja: ここでドリフトを見てた

translation.en: Things were different back then.
Once I got my license, I practically lived up here.
translation.ja: 免許を取って すぐここに来た

translation.en: Back then, kids just drove whatever they had.
translation.ja: みんな好きに走ってた

translation.en: You know, we just made do. No one bothered us.
translation.ja: どんな車でも関係なかった

translation.en: The day I got my license is the day I got my first speeding ticket.
translation.ja: 俺は免許を取った日に スピード違反でやられた

translation.en: The day after that, I won my first race.
translation.ja: 翌日 初めてのレース

translation.en: I beat this rich kid by three lengths.
translation.ja: 金持ちのガキをブッチギった

translation.en: I gotta admit, it felt good.
translation.ja: 正直 気分よかった

translation.en: It felt like--
Like everything else just disappears.
translation.ja: ほかのことなど消え去る

translation.en: No past and no future.
No problems.
Just the moment.
Boy needs to chill.
Hey, Twink, I'm gonna grab another set.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa!
Look, that was your third set today. I mean, them tires ain't cheap.
translation.ja: 今日 ３回換えた タイヤは高いんだぞ

translation.en: DK, grab a chair. We're about to roast some marshmallows.
translation.ja: ＤＫ　座れよ マシュマロがあるぞ

translation.en: Yo, come on, man, look--
Stay away from her, or the only thing you'll be driving is a wheelchair.
translation.ja: 彼女に近づくな 歩けなくするぞ

translation.en: Find yourself a new driver.
I'm all right.
What'd you expect?
You didn't just play with fire, you soaked the matches in gasoline.
translation.ja: ガソリンにマッチを 放りこんだ

translation.en: It's over.
All this over a gaijin?
translation.ja: あのガイジンのせいか？

translation.en: I am a gaijin.
You've changed, DK.
You say I've changed.
But we're not so different, you and I.
We're both products of fuckups, aren't we?
translation.ja: お互い でき損ないの子供だ

translation.en: They say your mom was the best trick in all of Kabukicho back in the day.
translation.ja: お前のママは歌舞伎町一(いち)の 娼婦だった

translation.en: Leave my mother out of this.
If we hadn't taken you in, you'd be just like her,
translation.ja: お前も うちで世話しなければ ママと同じに―

translation.en: doing anything for a buck.
translation.ja: 金のために体を売ってた

translation.en: Think anyone would take a second look at you if it wasn't for your uncle?
translation.ja: あなただって 叔父さんがいなければ…

translation.en: We're the same, Neela.
Difference is I know who I am and where I belong.
translation.ja: 違いは 俺は生い立ちを知ってる

translation.en: Do you know who you are?
Do you know where you belong?
translation.ja: 自分が どこの人間かも 知らない

translation.en: Come on.
Hey, brother.
I vouched for you! Put my reputation on the line for you!
translation.ja: 信用してたのに 面子(めんつ)をツブされた！

translation.en: We were partners!
You think you can keep your side deals from me?
translation.ja: アガリを掠(かす)めやがって！

translation.en: Come on. We ain't in the Boy Scouts.
translation.ja: よせよ 子供じゃないぞ

translation.en: This is what we do.
What about now?
Hmm? Is this what we do?
Man, you need me.
You'd still be shaking down teahouses for chump change if it wasn't for me.
translation.ja: まだ喫茶店を脅して 小金を集めてた

translation.en: Get in!
Go! Go! Go!
Come on.
Sean. Sean!
I wouldn't do that if I were you.
I'll go with you.
Neela.
See you when Daddy's not around.
I'm putting you on a plane tonight.
translation.ja: 今夜 飛行機に乗れ

translation.en: -Dad-- -Sean, don't argue with me.
I did this. I can't run away.
translation.ja: 僕のせいだ　逃げたくない

translation.en: I can't.
Sean, I'm your father. I'm responsible for your well-being.
translation.ja: 私はお前の父親だ お前に責任がある

translation.en: And I'm responsible for my mess.
I gotta do this.
Can you understand that?
At least you're not redoing my mistakes.
translation.ja: 俺も昔 後悔をした

translation.en: You all right, man?
We're leaving town.
Look, I know some people--
I can't do it, Twink.
Look, DK wants your head. All right?
translation.ja: お前 ＤＫに殺されるぞ いいか

translation.en: And the trouble you just made for Kamata? You're done here, bro.
translation.ja: ＤＫの叔父貴のカマタも 頭に来てる

translation.en: Maybe I should talk to Kamata.
DK answers to him.
I know I just didn't hear that.
I gotta end this. I'm gonna go talk to him.
translation.ja: 彼と話して カタをつける

translation.en: What, are you crazy, huh?
Han is dead, all right!
Plus, you can't just walk into Kamata's place, man!
translation.ja: カマタに会うのもヤバい

translation.en: It's all I got.
Something I think Han would've wanted you to have.
What's this?
You're gonna need it if you're gonna make it out of Kamata's place alive.
translation.ja: カマタと会うのに 必要だ

translation.en: Don't you need it?
No, it's cool. Look, I'll figure it out.
translation.ja: いいさ 俺は何とかなる

translation.en: Sean.
You need to leave.
You came to the wrong place.
I didn't come here to see you.
You think you can walk in here,
translation.ja: お前― 金を渡せば 無事帰れると 思って来たのか？

translation.en: dump some cash and walk out?
translation.ja: 金を渡せば 無事帰れると 思って来たのか？

translation.en: I know I'm only returning what belonged to you in the first place, sir.
translation.ja: 先に あなたの物を お返しします

translation.en: But that's not why I really came.
I came here to apologize.
I know your nephew and I have embarrassed ourselves badly.
translation.ja: ＤＫと僕は 互いに恥を晒(さら)しました

translation.en: Sir, I'm here to offer you a peaceful solution.
translation.ja: 平穏な解決を提案に来ました

translation.en: How do you plan to accomplish that?
translation.ja: 何をしようと思ってる？

translation.en: A race.
DK and I have caused nothing but problems for you, for us.
translation.ja: ＤＫと僕は みんなに 迷惑をかけました

translation.en: And I'm asking you to allow us to settle this, once and for all.
translation.ja: これで きれいに カタをつけたい

translation.en: We race
and the loser leaves town for good.
I've already beat this piece of shit once!
translation.ja: こいつには一度勝った

translation.en: Good.
Then it should be easy.
translation.ja: だったら また勝て

translation.en: The cops took all the cars.
translation.ja: ハンの車は押収された

translation.en: That's why she's spitting.
We almost there, Twink. Couple more tweaks.
translation.ja: もうチョイだ 完成は近い

translation.en: It's not the car I'm worried about, man.
DK picked this road for a reason.
translation.ja: ＤＫが ここを選んだのは―

translation.en: This is his mountain.
He's the only one to ever make it to the bottom.
translation.ja: 完走したのは奴だけだ

translation.en: Damn! Come on, man! That ain't right.
Hey, yo, Sean! Yo, Sean!
translation.ja: ショーン ショーン

translation.en: Hey, check this out, man.
This dude over here wanna race the new DK.
translation.ja: お前に挑戦者が現れた

translation.en: Heard he's been beating everybody around Asia, too.
translation.ja: アジアでは無敵だそうだ

translation.en: Not tonight, Twinkie.
Said he knew Han.
Said Han was family.
All right. Let's race.
Nice ride.
I won it from our friend Han a few years ago.
translation.ja: 数年前 ハンに勝って頂いた

translation.en: I didn't know he was into American muscle.
He was when he was rolling with me.
You know this ain't no 10-second race.
I got nothing but time.
You ready, kid?
Ready!
Set!
Go!
♪ Rock, I rock ♪ ♪ I rock, I rock, I rock ♪
translation.ja: プロのスタントマンによる 演技である

translation.en: ♪ I roll, I roll, I roll ♪ ♪ Rock, I rock ♪ ♪ I rock, I rock, I rock ♪
translation.ja: この映画のマネは危険なので 絶対しないように
